42 SMITHSOXIAX MISCELLANEOUS COLLECTIONS 

1905. March 7; Imperial. 

1905. March 12; Cloverdale. 

1905. March 18; Bakersfiekl. Isabella. Xordhoff, San Francisco. "Wasco; 
 S:40 p. m. VI. 

1905. March 2i; Cloverdale. 

1905. April 3; Boulder Creek, Hollister, Salinas, San JosC', Santa Cniz; 2 
 a. m. 

1905. April 4; Boulder Creek, Hollister, Salinas, San Jose, Santa Cruz. 

Xiles; 2:25 a. m.- — Win. Barry. 

Lick Observator}-. Light shock 2:23:00 a. m., lasting about 3 seconds,, 
 followed by a second shock of equal intensity, also lasting about 
 3 seconds. Records obtained from both instruments. — E. Smith. 

1905. April 17; Eedding. 

1905. April 18; San Francisco. 

1905. April 19; Santa Cruz. 

1905. April 23; Calexico, Cam])o, Idyllwiid, Imperial. 

1905. April 24; Point Loma. 

1905. April 27; Boulder Creek, Imperial, San Francisco, Santa Cruz. 

Oakland, Chabot Observatory. Observer, Professor Burckhalter; 
 9:10 p. m., intensity IT. 

Xiles; 9:53 p. m. 

1905. April 28; Xiles; 12:25 a. m. — Wni. Barry. 

I^ick Observatory. Light shock. Ewing record shows slight motion 
 north-south and east-west. Xo vertical motion; 9:41:17 a. m. 

1905. April 29; Hollister, Eiverside, Ventura. 

1905. April 30; Idyllwiid. 

1905. May 6; Lick Observatory. Light shock accompanied by a rumbling 
 noise; 12:01:20 p. m. Xo records on instruments. 

1905. May 10; Zenia. 

1905. May 15; Xevada City, Oakdale, Yosemite. 

1905. May 16; Yosemite. 

Berkeley; 7:50 p. m.
